required_param.description: Clear description of what this parameter does
required_param._comment: Add constraints like minLength, maxLength, pattern for strings

optional_param._comment: Numeric types should have min/max bounds

enum_param.description: Use enum when choices are finite and known
enum_param._comment: Enums prevent invalid values and guide LLM

array_param.description: Array with specific item type and size constraints
array_param._comment: Always specify items type and consider size limits

object_param.description: Nested object - keep nesting shallow (max 2-3 levels)
object_param._comment: Consider flattening if nesting gets too deep

complex_param_with_example._comment: Examples are critical for non-obvious formats

inputSchema._comment_required: Only include truly required parameters. If 80%+ of calls use same value, make it optional with default.

description_checklist: Does it start with an action verb?
Does it specify input format and constraints?
Is it clear without external context?
schema_checklist: Enums used for finite choice sets?

common_mistakes.vague_description: Change 'Processes data' to 'Validates user config against JSON schema'
common_mistakes.missing_constraints: Add minLength, maxLength to strings; minimum, maximum to numbers
common_mistakes.any_type: Replace 'any' with specific type or union (oneOf)
common_mistakes.deep_nesting: Flatten nested objects or split into multiple tools
